item.title: Report E-2023120206
item.description:
Report E-2023120206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 4, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2031 had a faulty cap in transit and leaked approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the top and sides of drum, as well as the poly wrap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel removed all contaminated poly wrap to inspect the drum. Crews utilized rags and a neutralizing solution to collect the released product from the top and sides of the drum. GMES personnel utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120418
item.description:
Report X-2023120418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: BEND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived at the ZBND location in a trailer from the NPRS location. Upon being unloaded, it was discovered that the package had previously leaked. Nobody was exposed to the material, and it was taken to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: A small amount (~1 ounce) of material leaked through the side of the seal of the container lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The material was contained to the exterior of the package and already dried. Nothing and nobody came into contact with the material. It was then placed into a HazMat spill bin and transported to the QA area.

item.title: Report X-2023120752
item.description:
Report X-2023120752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE TRAILER OF DOOR. THE PACKAGE AND AFFECTED MATERIAL WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. AN SDS LOOK UP FROM THE MANUFACTURER INDICATED THAT THE PRODUCT, "NANOSKIN SPEEDY BRITE ORGANIC WHEEL TIRE ACID CLEANER," WAS LISTED AS "UN1850, PHOSPHORIC ACID SOLUTION" UNDER SECTION 14. RESPONDER REPORTED THE PACKAGE AS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED HAZMAT TO RMP. REPORTED THE INCIDENT TO THE HMSC. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER: 1ZB791640313737667

item.title: Report X-2023120751
item.description:
Report X-2023120751

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: EUGENE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. THE SIDE OF THE BOX BUSTED OPEN BY THE STRAIN OF THE CONTENTS PUSHING ON THE SIDES OF THE BOX. EMPLOYEE NOTICED THE BATTERIES IN THE BOX. THEN NOTICED THERE WERE NO OUTER MARKINGS INDICATING THAT THERE WERE LITHIUM BATTERIES PACKED IN WITH EQUIPMENT. PROCESSED AS UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023111252
item.description:
Report X-2023111252

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from sortation, an brought to QA. DescribePack: One jug of bleach had a cracked, leaking cap. Package consisted of 3 bundled packs of one (5.32 Liter) jug and one (946 mL) spray bottle. Tape on bottom of box had failed and box was open, contents were in a separate bin than outer package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined spill bin and brought to appropriate damage processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023111305
item.description:
Report X-2023111305

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE FOUND HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH A STRONG SMELL COMING FROM IT. RESPONDER USED SPILL CART WITH ALL PPE STILL ON. FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE TO RESPOND PROPERLY TO THE PACKAGE. THERE WAS NO SPILL OR AFFECTED MATERIAL TO CLEAN UP AND REMOVE FROM THE SITE. THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTING THE HAZMAT CONTAINER INSIDE OF THE BOX, THERE WAS RESIDE ON AND AROUND THE CAP INDICATING A LEAK HAD OCCURED. THE CAP ITSELF WAS NOT LOOSE.
